result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Philip M. CANON was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court finds defendant eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after he has served twelve (12) months of his sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment or work search.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Defendant is not to enter liquor stores and/or taverns.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle without ignition interlock for period of extended supervision.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

records.addlTxt:
NO CONTEST plea entered to count 1, OWI - 8th offense.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in count 2, prohibited BAC.  Motion granted.
Presentence Investigation Report ordered.
PSI due to the court by 11-13-15.
Sentencing hearing is set for 11-23-15 at 1:30 p.m.
The Court revokes defendant's bail until sentencing and defendant is taken into custody.  
Court orders the defendant to submit to a DNA sample.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.

Information filed.  Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 02-17-15 at 2:00 p.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 01-21-15 at 1:30 p.m.  
Defense counsel asks the court to delete the condition where the defendant is not allowed to drive.  State objects.  Court denies the motion.

RE:  OWI (8th) offense, on 12-21-14.
At 7:00 p.m., $2,000.00 cash bail furnished and defendant released from custody.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of OWI - 8th offense.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 01-05-15 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $2,000.00 cash with the conditions that he not operate a motor vehicle, not travel outside the State of Wisconsin and maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
